source: Mindanao Goldstar Daily; Philippine Daily Inquirer

On 1 April 2020, a suspected NPA militant was killed during a 20-minute firefight between the NPA and the military in Barangay Balagon, Siay, Zamboanga Sibugay. The military said it was conducting an information campaign in the barangay on the COVID-19 (Coronavirus) pandemic when the encounter took place. The military reported no casualties and said it retrieved weapons from the rebels. The clash happened while the respective ceasefire declarations of the government and the rebels are in effect until 15 April 2020 amid the pandemic.

source: GMA News; Philippine Daily Inquirer; Abante
notes: On 1 April 2020, a suspected NPA militant was killed while a government soldier was wounded during a clash between the NPA and the military in Barangay Ilayang Yuni, Mulanay, Quezon. The military reported no casualties and said it retrieved weapons from the rebels. The clash happened while the respective ceasefire declarations of the government and the rebels are in effect until 15 April 2020 amid the pandemic.

source: Manila Bulletin; GMA News; ABS CBN
notes: On 1 April 2020, a drug suspect - who was also a village volunteer monitoring the implementation of a COVID-19 (coronavirus)-related curfew - was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants while he was on duty at the monitoring booth in Barangay Bagong Silangan, Quezon City. Police said the victim was on the drug watchlist.

notes: On 1 April 2020, residents of Sitio San Roque, Barangay Bagong Pag-Asa, Quezon City, who were part of the community organization Samahan ng Magkakapitbahayang North Triangle Association (SAMANA), staged a demonstration by the Epifanio de los Santos (EDSA) Avenue in the same city to decry the supposed lack of government aid during the Luzon-wide Enhanced Community Quarantine (ECQ) implemented amid the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic. Police dispersed the demonstration and arrested 21 demonstrators for supposedly violating ECQ guidelines through their public gathering. [size=at least 21]

From 29 March to 4 April 2020, more than 1,000 individuals were arrested by the police in Bacolod, Negros Occidental, for purportedly violating measures put in place amid the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic. Some of the arrested were charged with disobedience to persons in authority.

On 2 April 2020, two drug suspects were shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Alambijud, Argao, Cebu. Police said one of the drug suspects had been in jail for illegal drugs. Police also said that the two fatalities were persons under monitoring (PUM) for COVID-19 (coronavirus) due to their travel history.

On 2 April 2020, an ambulance driver was wounded after being shot by an unidentified assailant in Candelaria, Quezon. The assailant harassed the ambulance driver for parking the ambulance in a residential district and said that the ambulance could be infected with the COVID-19 (coronavirus). The hospital called for justice and decried the attack as an example of discrimination health workers are increasingly facing in the midst of the coronavirus pandemic.

On 2 April 2020, a farmer was shot dead by police at a national highway checkpoint set up amid the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic in Barangay Amontay, Nasipit, Agusan del Sur. The farmer was scolded by checkpoint personnel for not wearing a face mask. Police allege that the farmer became unruly towards a health worker and Barangay officials, and attempted to hack a police officer with a scythe. The farmer was the first civilian casualty after President Rodrigo Duterte told military and police the previous day that they were authorized to shoot dead those found in violation of coronavirus-related measures.

Police said the drug suspect had previously been detained on drug charges.
On 3 April 2020, a former Barangay captain was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Banacao, Bangued, Abra. The motive for the killing was unclear.

On 4 April 2020, a drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Poblacion Occidental, Consolacion, Cebu. Police said that the drug suspect had just been released from jail a few months prior, after being detained on drug charges.

On 5 April 2020, 41 individuals were arrested by the police in Bacolod, Negros Occidental, for purportedly violating curfews put in place amid the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic. The arrested were given a warning then released.

Police said the community kitchen was in violation of Enhanced Community Quarantine measures in effect across Luzon amid the pandemic. The government arrested 21 San Roque residents the previous week for a coronavirus-related demonstration. KADAMAY had been previously red-tagged by the government.

The clash happened while the respective ceasefire declarations of the government and the rebels are in effect until 15 April 2020 amid the pandemic. The cadaver of one of the slain militants was only found days later by a civilian.

On 23 April 2020, a police asset in the drug war who had also formerly surrendered for illegal drug activity was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay 1, Bais, Negros Oriental. Police said the victim was likely targeted after several were already arrested on drug charges thanks to information he had provided.
On 23 April 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Camp Rinio, Cabanatuan, Nueva Ecija. Police said a sachet of shabu was recovered from the fatality.

On 23 April 2020, a drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Poblacion, Sierra Bullones, Bohol. The fatality, who was picking up COVID-19 (coronavirus) government assistance when he was attacked, was on the local drug watchlist, according to police.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; ABS CBN; Sunstar (Philippines); Philippine Star
notes: On 24 April 2020, three Abu Sayyaf militants were killed while seven MNLF fighters were wounded during a 40-minute clash between the Abu Sayyaf and the MNLF in Barangay Kagay, Indanan, Sulu. Abu Sayyaf militants were reportedly massing up near an MNLF camp in the area prior to the encounter.

On 24 April 2020, 65 individuals were arrested by the police in Sampaloc, Manila, after reportedly violating a 48-hour so-called hard lockdown implemented in the area on top of standard government quarantine measures in response to the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic.

On 24 April 2020, 44 Chinese nationals and 9 Filipinos were arrested by the police in Paranaque for operating offshore gaming in violation of quarantine measures implemented by the government amid the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic. These quarantine measures include the suspension of non-essential work.
On 24 April 2020, a soldier was killed during a firefight between the NPA and the military in Barangay Balukbahan, Bayog, Zamboanga del Sur.

On 24 April 2020, a police officer and a local government employee were wounded in an encounter with suspected NPA militants near the boundary of Barangays Real and Rizal, Monreal, Masbate. The police officer and the local government employee had reportedly just come from a pandemic relief mission.

source: ABS CBN; Sunstar (Philippines); Cebu Daily News; Philippine News Agency
notes: On 24 April 2020, four NPA militants were killed while two government soldiers were wounded during a 30-minute firefight between the NPA and a joint military and police team in Barangay Gawahon, Victorias City, Negros Occidental. The joint military and police team were reportedly conducting a security patrol and were disseminating information on the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic in the area when the encounter took place. The joint team reported retrieving weapons and other items from the rebels.

On 25 April 2020, two drug suspects were killed while another was arrested during a police raid in Barangay Canlubang, Calamba, Laguna. Police said that the suspects were part of a known drug and robbery group and that several grams of shabu (crystal meth) were recovered from them.

On 25 April 2020, an NPA militant was shot dead during a 15-minute firefight between the NPA and the military in Lumba-Bayabao, Lanao del Sur. The military also said that it overran an NPA encampment in the area and retrieved weapons and other items.
On 25 April 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Matangtubig, Baliuag, Bulacan. Police said that sachets of shabu (crystal meth) were recovered from the suspect.

On 26 April 2020, the NPA and the military engaged in a firefight in Barangay Cambigsi, Bilar, Bohol. There were no reported casualties on either side. The military said it was securing the area for the local government's distribution of COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic aid when the clash happened.

On 27 April 2020, an unidentified armed group that was storming the satellite office of a town mayor was engaged by responding MILF militants in a firefight in Barangay Gadungan, Sultan Sumagka (formerly Talitay), Maguindanao. The police later arrived and came to the aid of the MILF, after which the unidentified armed group withdrew. The MILF recently began decommissioning its weapons as part of the 2014 peace plan. In recent years, they have assisted the military in fighting Islamist groups in the region. Police said a political rivalry was the likely motive for the attack on the office.

On 27 April 2020, a police officer was wounded during an encounter with drug suspects suspected by police to be marijuana cultivators in Barangay Pangamihan, Toledo, Cebu, as police were conducting surveillance in the area. The drug suspects escaped.

On 27 April 2020, an NPA fighter was shot dead during a five-minute clash between the NPA and the military in Barangay P. Rebadulla, Catubig, Northern Samar. Police said that there were no casualties on their side and that they retrieved weapons from the rebels.
On 27 April 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Prieto Diaz, Sorsogon.

source: Manila Bulletin; Philippine Star; ABS CBN; Philippine News Agency; Sunstar (Philippines); GMA News; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: On 28 April 2020, an Abu Sayyaf militant was killed during a nine-minute firefight between the Abu Sayyaf and the military in Barangay Tumantangis, Indanan, Sulu. The military also reported retrieving weapons and other items.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Mindanao Goldstar Daily
notes: On 29 April 2020, two NPA militants were killed while two others were arrested during a firefight between the NPA and the military in Barangay Lamfugon, Lake Sebu, South Cotabato. The military also reported retrieving weapons and other items.
On 29 April 2020, a former town councilor and his wife were shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Piacan, Sirawai, Zamboanga del Norte. The motive for the attack was unclear.

assoc_actor_2: Government of the Philippines (2016-); MNLF: Moro National Liberation Front
source: Philippine Star; Philippine News Agency; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: On 29 April 2020, a Barangay chairperson was shot dead while a Barangay councilor was wounded in an attack by suspected clan militiamen in Barangay Marbel, Matalam, Cotabato. Police said that the attack is related to a political clan feud. Later reports indicated that the militia was linked to a clan associated with the MILF, while the attacked Barangay councilor was from a clan associated with the MNLF. However, authorities said that the conflict was not organizational.

actor1: AKP: Ansar al-Khilafah in the Philippines
source: ABS CBN; Philippine Star; Tempo (Philippines); Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: On 29 April 2020, two police officers were killed in a firefight with unidentified assailants in Barangay Koronadal Proper, Polomolok, South Cotabato. Police described the attack as an ambush and said it was the work of an illegal drug syndicate. A later report identified the group as the Ansar al-Khilafah in the Philippines, which police said was involved in illegal drugs and other crimes.

On 30 April 2020, around 260 individuals from Barangay Camudlas, Bindoy, Negros Oriental, as well as other nearby barangays, were displaced following a clash between the NPA and the military in the said barangay. The evacuating families were sheltered in a school closer to the town center.

On 30 April 2020, two NPA militants were killed while a government soldier was wounded during two clashes between the NPA and the military in Barangay Guibonon, Esperanza, Agusan del Sur. The military reported retrieving weapons from the rebels.

assoc_actor_2: Government of the Philippines (2016-); MNLF: Moro National Liberation Front
notes: On 30 April 2020, in Barangay Marbel, Matalam, Cotabato, suspected militiamen linked to a clan associated with the MILF torched a pickup truck that the group of people they ambushed the previous day - including a Barangay councilor from a rival clan associated with the MNLF - were in during the ambush. Authorities said that the torching of the vehicle was part of ongoing hostilities between the two clans and was not an organizational conflict between the MILF and MNLF.

source: ABS CBN; Philippine News Agency; Abante; Cebu Daily News; Sunstar (Philippines)
notes: On 30 April 2020, three NPA militants were killed while a government soldier was wounded during a 30-minute firefight between the NPA and the military in Barangay Camudlas, Bindoy, Negros Oriental. Two civilians were also wounded. The military also reported retrieving weapons and other items.

On 30 April 2020, a prominent Bayan Muna official and activist was shot dead by suspected police elements in Barangay Santo Nino Norte, Arevalo, Iloilo City, Iloilo. According to Bayan Muna, the victim was harassed by police in previous weeks. Bayan Muna also said that the victim was leading the party's relief operations and education campaign on the COVID-19 (Coronavirus) pandemic in poor communities in Iloilo City. Bayan Muna is often red-tagged by the government.

On 30 April 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Santo Nino, Plaridel, Bulacan. Police said that the suspect was on the local drug watchlist and that they retrieved several sachets of shabu (crystal meth) from him during the raid.

On 30 April 2020, a suspected Dawlah Islamiyah militant was killed while two others were wounded during a firefight between Dawlah Islamiyah and the military in Barangay Laguilayan, Isulan, Sultan Kudarat. The government soldiers were on patrol when the clash happened. The military reported retrieving weapons and bomb-making materials from the rebels.

On 30 April 2020, two NPA militants were killed during a firefight between the NPA and the police in Macarthur, Monreal, Masbate. The firefight erupted after police attempted to serve a warrant of arrest in the area. Police said they recovered weapons from the rebels.
On 30 April 2020, a laborer was shot dead by suspected NPA militants in Cawayan, Masbate. Police said the motive for the attack was unclear.
